results.title: Your body and its parts
results.creator_credit: David Bennett and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Life Science”.
Provides an overview of human physiology. Illustrates the body parts working together to do a job and forming a system. Introduces the muscular, respiratory, circulatory, skeletal and nervous systems.

results.title: Trees and their importance
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of “Basic life science” series
Discusses conservation, explaining the importance of trees as a renewable resource andtheir role in water and soil conservation. Describes the life processes of a tree and how trees contribute to the welfare of humans.

results.title: Your health: your food
results.creator_credit: David Bennett and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Life Science”.
Shows what happens to food when it enters the digestive system and relates this system to other body systems. Presents examples of a balanced diet. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The World of animals: looking at amphibians
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Life Science”.
Studies frogs, toads and salamanders to show how amphibians are adapted to spend their early life in water and their adult life on land. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Life story of the oyster
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Life Science”.
Oysters belong to the mollusc family - two irregularly shaped shells protect the oyster’s soft body. The interior of the shell is lined with smooth white mother of pearl. We see how increased demands and modern sea farming methods have greatly increased the number of oysters being harvested annually. America imports “seed” oysters from Japan to increase production.

results.title: Food from the sun
results.creator_credit: Thomas Smith and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Life Science”.
Uses demonstrations and animated drawings to show how all life on earth relies on the sun for energy. Explains the process of photosynthesis. Suitable for middle primary level.

group_works.title: A Visual dictionary
group_works.creator_credit: Sheldon Renan, David Adams and Pyramid Films

results.title: A Visual dictionary
results.creator_credit: Sheldon Renan, David Adams and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Film Terms”.
Illustrates basic filmmaking language as it is used in the writing, shooting, and editing of a motion picture. Defines and demonstrates script terminology, kinds of shots, lenses and their effects, camera angles and movement, sound, and optical effects. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary/teacher levels.
